 Letter dated 29 October 2005 from the Secretary of State of the United States of America 

The Government of Iraq requested to extend the mandate of the Multinational Force (MNF) in Iraq. 
The MNF under unified command is ready to continue its mandate as set out in Security Council resolution 1546 (2004). 
The MNF and the Government of Iraq have an effective security partnership to address Iraq's security environment. 
The MNF is prepared to undertake tasks to contribute to security and stability, and ensure force protection, in close cooperation with the Government of Iraq. 
The forces of MNF will act consistently with their obligations under international law. 
Substantial progress has been made in building and training the Iraqi Security Forces (ISF) to take on security responsibilities. 
A security plan is being developed to transfer security responsibility from the MNF to the ISF. 
The goal is for the Iraqi forces to assume full responsibility for security and stability in Iraq. 
The co-sponsors intend to annex the present letter to the resolution on Iraq under consideration.
